creator: yasere@yahoo.com
text:
Hello;
I downloaded Apache 2.0.43 and PHP 4.2.3 and when ever I try to install PHP to 
work with Apache I get the following answer.
Will you please help
apache: module "c:\php4build\snap\sapi\apache2filter\sapi_apache2.c" is not 
comp
atible with this version of Apache (found 20020628, need 20020903).
Please contact the vendor for the correct version.

The module you are trying to use is not (binary-) compatible with your version
of Apache. As you can see by the dates (found 20020628, need 20020903), Apache
needs a newer version of PHP. This is not a bug of Apache.

As a solution try to use a newer version of PHP, for example from the daily
snapshots, which you can find here:
http://snaps.php.net/

Another solution would be to build the module from the sources by yourself.

Thanks for using Apache!
creator: erik@codefaktor.de
